info.headline: Flood Warning issued October 11 at 5:17AM MST until October 11 at 8:15AM MST by NWS Flagstaff AZ
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...Portions of north central and west central Arizona, including the following counties, in north central Arizona, Coconino. In west central Arizona, Yavapai.
* WHEN...Until 815 AM MST.
* IMPACTS...Flooding of creeks and normally dry washes is imminent or occurring.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 512 AM MST, Heavy rain from showers and thunderstorms have dropped between 1.00 and 3.00 inches of rain in the past 24 hours. The West Clear Creek is already running high and the additional rainfall overnight has caused a second rise to occur at the stream gage on West Clear Creek. Water will continue to move downstream over the next few hours. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. - This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Clover Creek, Long Canyon, West Clear Creek, and Verde River. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Camp Verde, Indian Maiden Falls, Hanging Garden, Bullpen Day Use Area, Verde Lakes, Rockin' River Ranch State Park, and West Clear Creek Wilderness. - This includes State Route 260 between mile markers 225 and 231.
This includes the following recreation areas and campgrounds... Clear Creek Group Campgrounds.
This includes the following swimming holes... Bull Pen Day Use Area, West Clear Creek near the campground and Indian Maiden Falls. - Additional information is available at weather.gov/flagstaff.
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Low water crossings will become dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
Report flooding to local law enforcement or NWS Flagstaff on our Facebook or Twitter pages when you can do so safely.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 815 AM MST THIS MORNING
